page.title: 14Buses in Longnor
page.content: Buses are a type of public and private transport. They are a very good type of transport if you haven't got your own means of transport. They link Buxton, Longnor, Sheen, Warslow and Leek. Clewes take trips to Altringham ice rink. Clewes, Suttons, Blackhursts, Coopers and Wints take children to school, either to Warslow or Leek. Warslow schoolchildren go swimming on Tuesdays and Wints' bus takes them. If they go on a visit somewhere, it is usually Coopers who take them. The school buses run on weekdays and the Buxton bus runs every day except Sundays, weekdays at 8a.m. and 3p.m., Saturdays every 2 hours. It costs 60 pence to do the whole journey Warslow to Buxton. The Leek bus goes every Wednesday.
